ornamental: Banded Agate: Brown, blue, red, and white stripes
Eye Agate: Gray, white, brown, blue, and green circles
Lapis Lazuli: Light or dark blue with yellow flecks
Malachite: Striated light and dark green
Moss Agate: Pink, yellow-white with gray-green moss-like markings
Tiger Eye Agate: Rich golden brown with dark striping
semi-precious: Bloodstone: Dark gray with red flecks
Chrysoprase: Translucent apple to emerald green
Moonstone: White with pale blue hue
Onyx: Black, white, or bands of both
Sardonyx: Bands of red and white
Smoky Quartz: light gray, yellow, brown or blue
Star Rose Quartz: Smoky rose with white star center
fancy: Garnet: Deep red to violet crystal
Jade: Light to dark green or white
Pearl: Pure white, rose, to black
Spinel: Red, red-brown, green, or deep blue
Tourmaline: Pale green, blue, brown, or red
precious: Garnet: Deep red to violet crystal
Pearl: Pure white, rose, to black
Spinel: Red, red-brown, green, or deep blue
gems: Black Opal: Dark green with black mottling and golden flecks
Opal: Pale blue with green and gold mottling
jewels: Black Sapphire: Rich black with highlights
Diamond: Clear blue-white, rich blue, yellow, or pink
Ruby: Clear to deep crimson red
Star Ruby: Translucent ruby with white star highlights
Star Sapphire: Translucent blue with white star highlights

scroll.note: If priest scroll and level[1] > 7 then level[1] = level[1] - 2

comment.chance: 1 in 20 chance container is trapped. 1-5 in 20 chance chest is trapped

fantasy: Bluewood (errie blue leaves, burns bright blue, silver hue to wood)
Duskwood (smoky gray wood, hard as iron, fire resistant)
Phendar (green-brown wood with thin black grain lines)
Shadowtop (strong fibrous wood, good for ropemaking, unsuitable for carving or loadbearing; it splits)
Suth (hard durable wood, hard to work with, very strong)
Weirwood (will not burn in a normal fire, resilient durable wood)
Zabunter (black bark and wood, strong, easily worked)
Darkwood (weighs half as much as normal wood)
Hell Metals (Green Steel/devil, Morghuth Iron/daemon, Bloodiron/demon)

names: The Ambassador Who Hates the Dreamer
Zoron The Unholy Earl That Prefers the Pretender

comment.Magical art: Instead of Magical art, jewelry replaces Magical. This is because the DMG considers jewelry to be objects of art and magical treasure is covered elsewhere in the DMG
comment.DMG definition of Objects of Art: This category includes jewelry, ornamental drinking vessels, elaborate snuff boxes, fine crystal and glass, statuary, carvings, and all the other small embellishments that make life more pleasant and easy to bear.
comment.pottery / ceramic: This is original and comes from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pottery and child pages
